task_name.desc: Choice Under Risk and Ambiguity Task

cite: Hsu, M., Bhatt, M., Adolphs, R., Tranel, D., & Camerer, C. F. (2005). Neural systems responding to degrees of uncertainty in human decision-making. Science, 310(5754), 1680-1683. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.1115327

data_columns.subjID: A unique identifier for each subject in the data-set.
data_columns.prob: Objective probability of the variable lottery.
data_columns.ambig: Ambiguity level of the variable lottery (0 for risky lottery; greater than 0 for ambiguous lottery).
data_columns.reward_var: Amount of reward in variable lottery. Assumed to be greater than zero.
data_columns.reward_fix: Amount of reward in fixed lottery. Assumed to be greater than zero.
data_columns.choice: If the variable lottery was selected, choice == 1; otherwise choice == 0.
